RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui licenciatura e bacharelado em Ciъncias Biolѓgicas com ъnfase em Biologia Marinha (2008) pela Universidade Santa Cecilia, especializaчуo em Ecologia e Intervenчѕes Ambientais (2014) pela Universidade Jorge Amado e mestrado em Ecologia e Biomonitoramento (2016) pela Universidade Federal da Bahia. Tem experiъncia em planejamento sistemсtico da conservaчуo, modelagem de nicho ecolѓgico e geoprocessamento. Seus principais interesses sуo os aspectos teѓricos e metodolѓgicos da seleчуo de сreas prioritсrias para a conservaчуo e os efeitos das mudanчas climсticas globais sobre a biodiversidade marinha. Outras сreas de interesse incluem impactos antrѓpicos em ambientes marinhos e costeiros, resgate, recuperaчуo, monitoramento e manejo de animais marinhos, conservaчуo de espщcies ameaчadas e gestуo ambiental.

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Prѓ-Reitoria de Pesquisa, Criaчуo e Inovaчуo

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Modelos ecolѓgicos aplicados р conservaчуo marinha frente рs mudanчas climсticas e рs lacunas de informaчуo
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Spatial conservation prioritization is an effective framework to select areas for conservation. Marine areas are protected than terrestrial ones although being under high antropic impact. Also, the goals for the future are less ambitious in marine ecosystems. Here, we identify priority areas for conservation in the coastal zone of Brazil. We used ecological niche models of threatened starfish considering current and future (2100) environmental variables. Additionally, we included a layer of anthropic impacts. We used the resulting suitability maps as input data to perform a spatial prioritization analysis. We developed three different conservation planning solutions and compared their performance in terms of conservation benefits. Considering human impact and climate change appears to be the most promising solution for current and future distribution of species. This conservation solution results in a lower human impact in priority areas and guarantee a high amount of suitable areas for the target species in the present and in the future. Our approach exemplifies how conservation actions can be improved by considering current and future threats to biodiversity.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: Spatial conservation prioritization is an effective framework to select areas for conservation. Marine areas are protected than terrestrial ones although being under high antropic impact. Also, the goals for the future are less ambitious in marine ecosystems. Here, we identify priority areas for conservation in the coastal zone of Brazil. We used ecological niche models of threatened starfish considering current and future (2100) environmental variables. Additionally, we included a layer of anthropic impacts. We used the resulting suitability maps as input data to perform a spatial prioritization analysis. We developed three different conservation planning solutions and compared their performance in terms of conservation benefits. Considering human impact and climate change appears to be the most promising solution for current and future distribution of species. This conservation solution results in a lower human impact in priority areas and guarantee a high amount of suitable areas for the target species in the present and in the future. Our approach exemplifies how conservation actions can be improved by considering current and future threats to biodiversity.
